alert.note: Alert for Borden; Glasscock; Howard; Mitchell; Scurry (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued May 23 at 7:56PM CDT until May 23 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Northeastern Glasscock County in western Texas... Mitchell County in western Texas... Scurry County in western Texas... Eastern Borden County in western Texas... Eastern Howard County in western Texas... * Until 900 PM CDT. * At 755 PM CDT, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Fluvanna to 7 miles northeast of Garden City, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Less than one half mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 190 and 228. Locations impacted include... Snyder, Colorado City, Coahoma, Loraine, Fluvanna, Colorado City Airport, J B Thomas Reservoir, Lake Colorado City, Lake Colorado City State Park, Inadale, Champion Creek Reservoir, Westbrook, Vincent, Hermleigh, Randalls Corner, Winston Field, Cuthbert, Knapp, Buford and Dunn. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. To report severe weather, contact the National Weather Service, or your nearest law enforcement agency, who will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Midland. Strong to severe thunderstorms are also possible behind this wall of dust. Keep updated with this quickly evolving situation.
